result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian Matthew Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain GFE in fulltime employmenr, schooling, or combination of the two and when not fully engaged complete 10 hours community service per week.
No contact with C.L. and G.L.

May transfer to Wood Co.
It is up to the discretion of PO to determine if appropriate for defendant to have employment where defendant is working with at risk individuals or vulnerable individuals. 
Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed necessary by agent.
DNA sample w/ surcharge-unless already complete.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
and Demand for Discovery & Inspection

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 10:02am
State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer.  Deft appears with Atty Lou Ann Bohn.

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
State moves to:
For both counts the state statute number for the repeater should be changed to 939.62(1)(b) not sub (a)
Ct. 2 Bail Jumping- Misdemeanor- repeater 936.62(1)(b)>> D&RI
COURT grants above

PLEA: 
Ct. 1 Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts- repeater 936.62(1)(b)>> GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: w/hold sentencing. 3 years probation. CONDITIONS: Serve 30 days MCJ, may be with huber release for work, work search, or treatment if meets jail criteria. Probatation & Jail may be transfered to Wood County if county accepts deft. Deft had 45 days to report to jail. Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. No contact with C.L. and G.L. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of two, when not fully engaged complete 10 hours of community service per week. It is up to discretion of probation agent to determine if appropriate for deft to have employment where deft is working with at risk individuals or vulnerable individuals. Pay CC. Pay for DNA sample & surcharge, if DNA sample has already been completed, deft does not need to duplicate sample. No restitution requested. Zero days credit.

Detective Kevin Hamill (City of Marshfield) sworn and testifies - identifies defendant.
Argument by Atty Bohn on bind over - moves to dismiss; Argument by ADA Gramer.

COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information to be filed within 30 days.
